jql_About.description:
This module (JQueryLike) was inspired by the idea that some JQuery was too good to ditch. It is developed in a modular fashion and uses plain ES20xx, so not really (or really not, take your pick) suitable for older browsers. The module originally was written in 2021. In 2023 it was rewritten in a classfree object oriented fashion, inspired by a Douglas Crockford presentation. Now you won't find any this in the code anymore. It is not a replacement for JQuery. Consider it a subset of JQuery alike methods to retrieve, create, modify or manipulate (collections of) HTML elements in your HTML document. This document is completely built using JQL. Another example/demo-version can be found @kooiinc.github.io/JQL/TestNDemo. In the following you'll find documentation for usage of the module, divided into 4 chapters:
  • INSTANCE
    : all methods applicable to a JQL instance;
  • STATIC
    : JQL static module methods;
  • POPUP
    : JQL includes a module to create (modal) popup messages;
  • DEBUGLOG
    : JQL includes a module to extensively log everything it does (you do with it).
For all examples $ is the imported JQL module (so import $ from "[location of JQL]"). Most examples can be run (use the [Try it] button). If elements are created/modified in an example, the result is shown within the item at hand (and removed after a few seconds) or in a popup. The examples deliberately use all kinds of JQL methods, to familiarize the reader with them.
source code @Github

instance_text.description: Set the textcontent of all elements of the instance element collection. When textValue is empty, returns the current textcontent of the first element of the instance element collection. Otherwise returns the JQL Instance.

params.cb: Function. The lambda function to appy to every element of the collection.

instance_remove.description:
Removes every element of the instance element collection, or, when selector is present, removes every child element from of the instance element collection for which the selector applies. $(`p`).remove(); // => all

are removed from the document $(`p`).remove(`.toBeRemoved`); // => all are removed from the document $(`p`).remove(`:not(.keepMe)`); // => all

except `` are removed from the document

params.selector: string. A (valid) css selector string, e.g. #someDiv.someClass

params.dataAttribute: string. The data-attribute to query, e.q. width

params.valueWhenFalsy: Any. The value to return when the data-attribute was not found.

instance_is.description:
[JQL instance].is is a static property. To retrieve a value of it use [JQL instance].is[key]. If the JQL instance element collection is empty, the return values of all properties except empty will be "n/a". [JQL instance].is keys:
  • writable: is the first element of the JQL instance collection writable?
  • visible: is the first element of the JQL instance collection visible in the DOM?
  • disabled: is the first element of the JQL instance collection disabled?
  • open: is the first element of the JQL instance collection open (<details> or <dialog>)
  • modal: is the first element of the JQL instance collection modal (<dialog>)
  • empty: is the JQL instance element collection empty?
  • virtual: does the JQL instance only exist in memory?
const inpDisabled = $(``, /*[root element]*/); const is = inpDisabled.is; const features = [ `visible? ${is.visible}`, `disabled? ${is.disabled}`, `writable? ${is.writable}`, ]; popup.show( {content: `${$(`#disabledInput`).outerHtml.replace(/

${features.join(`
`)}

`} );

instance_hasClass.description:
For (the list of) className(s) determine if the first (root) element of the JQL Instance element collection contains (one of) the classNames. const tmpDiv = $(`
Hello world
`); popup.show( {content: `tmpDiv.hasClass("one", "tree") => ${tmpDiv.hasClass("one, tree")}
tmpDiv.hasClass("one", "four") => ${tmpDiv.hasClass("one, four")}
tmpDiv.hasClass("five") => ${tmpDiv.hasClass("five")}`, callback: () => $(`.one.two`).remove()} );

params.oldChild: JQL instance | HTMLElement | String. If String, a (valid) css selector.

instance_toDOM.description:
Add a 'virtual' element (an element created in memory, using the [instance].virtual method) to the DOM. Defaults to adding the element to the body, but root may be any element (if the DOM allows it). See
virtual
documentation for an example.

instance_append.description:
Appends one ore more elements to each element of the JQL Instance collection (for real, in the DOM tree). Notes:
  • when the JQL Instance to append to is empty, nothing will happen.
  • Appending one ore more JQL instances is destructive for the instance(s) to append: after appending the appended instance(s) can't be referenced. That is because the instance(s) collection(s) is/are appended to all elements of the instance to append to. So, when appending to an instance with multiple elements in its collection, the elements of the JQL instance(s) appended are clones of the original (the original is destroyed, see example). This means that chaining methods after an .append may give unpredictable results. For example   $(document.body).append($(`<button data-x="test123">test123</button>`)).on("click", evt => alert(`Am I 123? ${evt.target.dataset?.x}`) will add the click handler to document.body However:   $(`<p id="xyz">`).append($(`<button data-x="test123">test123</button>`).on("click", evt => alert(`Am I 123? ${evt.target.dataset?.x}`)) will preserve the handler for the button (note the brackets)
  • If (one of) elems2Append consists of html string(s), they should contain valid html (e.g., no flow content in elements expecting phrasing content, so for example no <h1> within <p>). The HTML is always sanitized.
  • Appending to more than one element (of the collection to append to) may give you problems when the element(s) to append contain an id (which may not be unique anymore)
$.editCssRule(`#tmpEx {color: green; font-weight: bold;}`); const toAppendJQLInstance = $.virtual(`
I am the appended one ...
`); $(`
Hi there!
`, evt.target.closest(`.description`)) .append(toAppendJQLInstance); // after appending the appended JQL instance collection is empty: popup.show( { content: `toAppendJQLInstance.HTML.get(1,1)
${toAppendJQLInstance.HTML.get(1,1)}`, })

params....elems2Append: string[] | HTMLElement[]| Text[] | Comment[] | JQL instance[]

params.type: string. Event type (e.g. click) to listen for

params.origin: string. Optional css identifying the element to assign listener to (e.g. #someId)

instance_duplicate.description:
Duplicate a JQL instance to memory (default) or to DOM (append to root). The elements within the instance are cloned, their id's are removed and the resulting NodeList is converted to a new JQL Instance. Note check the cloned nodes classList/properties/attributes: you may want to change them before injecting to DOM. const someElem = Object.assign( $.editCssRule(`.someClass`, {color: `brown`}); $(`
hello
`, /*[root]*/).duplicate(true, /*[root]*/); $( `.someClass`, /*[root]*/ ) .append($.text(` world!`)) .prepend($.text(`We say: `)) .each(el => el.setAttribute(`id`, `_${ Math.floor(10000 + Math.random() * 10000).toString(16)}` )) .duplicate(true, /*[root]*/) .removeClass(`someClass`) .addClass(`tmp`) .text(` That's right folks. Bye!`, true); /** output in DOM
We say: hello world!
We say: hello world!
We say: hello world! That's right folks. Bye!
We say: hello world! That's right folks. Bye!
*/

instance_css.description:
Style each element of the element collection of the JQL Instance within the custom style sheet (<style id="JQLStylesheet">), using an intermediate (generated, random) or given class name. Preferably use key-value pairs, even when assigning a single property. Notes
  • the intermediate className starts with "jQLClass-". There will be one intermediate class name per element. Subsequent .css calls will modify the rule for the generated class name.
  • using !important will be honored, e.g. {color: `green !important`}
// no className $(`

Hello #1

`, /*[root element]*/) .css({ paddingLeft: `4px`, color: `white`, backgroundColor: `#000` } ); popup.show( {content: `intermediate className: ${$.node(`#noClass`).classList.shift()}`} ); // className $(`

Hello #2

`, /*[root element]*/) .css({ className: `leftRedBorder`, paddingLeft: `4px`, color: `green`, borderLeft: `12px solid red` } );
See also [JQL instance].Style.inSheet

params.keyOrKvPairs: Object | string. If you want to use a className for the css, add a className property to the Object.

params.value: string | undefined. If value is a string, keyOrKvPairs must be a string too.

instance_empty.description:
Remove contents for all elements of the JQL instance element collection. Equivalent to
clear
instance_empty.returnValue: JQL Instance. An instance with elements without any content.

instance_removeAttribute.description: Remove some attribute from each element of the element collection of the JQL Instance.

params....nwClassNames: string[]. The class name(s) to replace className with.

instance_find.description: Find one or more elements within the first (root) element of the JQL Instance collection using a css query (e.g. '.someClass'). popup.show( {content: $(`.docs`).find(`#instance_find`)?.[0].outerHTML.replace(/

instance_find$.description: Find one or more elements within the JQL Instance collection using a css query (e.g. '.someClass') starting from the root element of the collection, and return a new JQL Instance from it's result popup.show( {content: $(`.docs`).find$(`#instance_find_D`)?.HTML.get(true, true)} ) // ^ note #[...] css selector can not contain $

params.indexOrSelector: Number | string. If string, a (valid) css selector.

instance_on.description:
Add listener and handler lambda('s) for the JQL Instance root element. The lambda signature is [handler function](event, JQLInstance). See
the toggleClass documentation
for examplary usage.

params....callback: Function[]. One or more handler functions (lambda's)

instance_outerHtml.description:
Retrieves the complete html for the first (root) element of the JQL Instance. Note: .outerHtml is a property (not a method). const exElem = $$(`
HelloWorld!
`, /*[root element]*/); popup.show( {content: `exElem.outerHtml => ${exElem.outerHtml.replace(/`} );

instance_parent.description:
Get the direct parentNode of the first (root) element of the JQL Instance (as new JQL Instance). Notes:
  • .parent is a property (not a method)
  • In (the unlikely) case there is no parent, .parent returns the original JQL instance.

instance_prepend.description:
Injects one or more elements at the start of each element of the collection of a JQL Instance. When (one of) elems2Prepend is a HTML string, it should be valid html, otherwise nothing is prepended obviously (e.g., no flow content in elements expecting phrasing content, so for example no <h1> within <p>). The syntax equals
append
. Notes:
  • elems2Prepend are always sanitized
  • When the JQL Instance to append to is empty, nothing will happen.
  • Prepending one ore more JQL instances is destructive for the instance(s) to prepend: after prepending the prepended instance(s) can't be referenced. That is because the instance collection is prepended to all elements of the instance to prepend to. So, when prepending to an instance with multiple elements in its collection, the elements of the JQL instance(s) prepended are clones of the original (the original is destroyed, see example). This means that chaining methods after a .prepend may give unpredictable results. For example   $(`<p id="xyz">`).prepend($(`<button id="test123">test123</button>`)).on("click", evt => alert(`Am I 123? ${evt.target.id}`) will add the click handler to p#xyz". However:   $(`<p id="xyz">`).prepend($(`<button data-x="test123">test123</button>`).on("click", evt => alert(`Am I 123? ${evt.target.dataset?.x}`)) will preserve the handler for the button (note the brackets)
  • Prepending to more than one element (of the collection to append to) may give you problems when the element(s) to prepend contain an id (which may not be unique anymore)
$.editCssRule(`#tmpEx {color: green; font-weight: bold;}`); $(`
... hi there!
`, /*[root element]*/).prepend(`
Hello and also ...
`);

params....elems2Prepend: string | HTMLElement | Text | Comment | JQL Instance (one or more)

instance_attr.description:
Get (keyOrObj string, [value] empty) attribute for the root element of the JQL Instance or set attributes for the first (root) element of the JQL Instance element collection. Notes:
  • to set data-attribute or style, use {[data/style]: {[key]: [value], ...} (see example)
  • To set multiple class-names, use a comma separated string of class names (e.g. [instance].attr({class: `class1, class2 ... classn`}))
  • All attributes are validated (so, e.g. no onclick etc.)
  • Setting an attribute value ([keyOrObj] returns the JQL instance.
  • See all information on attributes and properties @javascript.info
const someDiv = $(`
Hi, let me get some attributes
`, /*[root element]*/); someDiv.attr( { title: `Yes, I have a title now!`, class: `volatile`, data: {myTitle: `title as data`}, onclick: alert("will not be set!")} ); const [ myDataId, myTitle, myClass, myDataTitle, myOnclick ] = [ someDiv.attr(`data-id`), someDiv.attr(`title`), someDiv.attr(`class`), someDiv.attr(`data-my-title`), someDiv.attr(`onclick`)]; popup.show({ content: [ `someDiv.attr("data-id"): ${myDataId}`, `someDiv.attr("data-my-title"): ${myDataTitle}`, `someDiv.attr("title"): ${myTitle}`, `someDiv.attr("class"): ${myClass}`, `someDiv.attr(`onclick`), ].join(`
`) });

instance_About.description:
All methods applicable for an instance of JQL. An instance of JQL is anything created with the imported JQL constructor (here $). // in html use import $ from "//kooiinc.github.io/JQL/Bundle/jql.min.js"; // or any location you downloaded the JQL library to As said, JQL can be used to retrieve, create, modify or manipulate (collections of) HTML elements. The syntax [imported JQL constructor](input[, root, position]):
  • input: A (n Array of) HTML string(s), HTMLElement, JQL instance or a (valid) css selector
  • root: (HTMLElement | JQL Instance) The root element for the [input]. Default is document.body. When root is a JQL Instance, the first element of its collection is presumed to be the root.
  • position: (string) For creation of elements: where the instance should end up (relative to the root). You can use:
    • "beforebegin": (before [root], so [root] will be the first sibling of [input])
    • "afterbegin": (after the begin of [root], so [input] as first element of [root])
    • "beforeend": (before the end of [root], so [input] as last element of [root]))
    • "afterend": (after [root], so [input] will be the first sibling of [root])
Every JQL Instance has a three relevant static properties:
  • collection: Array<HTMLelement>: an Array with the collection of elements contained in the instance (so, $(`.someClass`).collection can contain 0 to n elements)
  • isVirtual: boolean: true if the instance is virtual (i.e. not (yet) in the DOM-tree)
  • isJQL: boolean: true if the instance is a JQL instance (so $.nodes(`.someClass`).isJQL is false) -
    see [JQL].nodes
Examples:
  • const exampleDiv = $(`<div id="example">Hello <div class="example">world</div></div>`);
  • const exampleDiv = $(`<div id="example"> world</div>`, $.node(`.example:first-child`), "afterbegin");
  • const exampleDiv = $(`meta, style`, document.documentElement);
  • const exampleDiv = $([`<div class="a">A</div>`, `<div class="B">B</div>`]);
  • const exampleDivs = $(`.example`);
  • const exampleSubDivs = $(`#example`).find$(`.example`);
  • ... etc
Where a method's return value is JQL Instance, method chaining is possible. $.editCssRules(`#tmpEx {color: green;}`, `.helloworld {font-weight: bold;}`); $(`
Hello world.
`, /*[root element]*/) .addClass(`helloworld`) .append(` And the rest of the universe!`) .text(` (will disappear shortly)`, true);
In the following every instance method is documented.

static_About.description:
Static methods are methods you can call using the imported JQL module. For example, when imported as $, $.editCssRule(...) or const popup = $.popup(). JQL also knows one static property for use with element creation: [imported JQL constructor].at for mapping a created elements' position relative to its parent, in other words: the position parameter from the
JQL constructor
. Its properties are ([input] is the element to add, [root] the element to add to):
  • BeforeBegin: (before [root], so [root] will be the first sibling of [input])
  • AfterBegin: (after the begin of [root], so [input] as first element of [root])
  • BeforeEnd: (before the end of [root], so [input] as last element of [root]))
  • AfterEnd: (after [root], so [input] will be the first sibling of [root])
So, instead of $(`<div id="example">Hi world</div>`, /*some root element*/, "afterbegin"), you can use $(`<div id="example">Hi world</div>`, /*some root element*/, $.at.AfterBegin) $.editCssRule(`h2.hello, h3.hello {margin: 0.3rem 0}`); const elemContainer = $.virtual(`
`).append($.virtual(`

world

`)); $.virtual(`

Hello

`, elemContainer.single(`.hello`), $.at.BeforeBegin); popup.show({content: elemContainer, callback: () => $.removeCssRule(`h2.hello, h3.hello`)});

instance_single.description:
When indexOrSelector has a value, retrieves the first matching element from a JQL Instance collection, or retrieves the first (root) element from the collection. The result will be a new JQL Instance (its collection may be empty). indexOrSelector is CSS Selector: $(`
Hello world (1)
Hello world (2)
`, /*[root element]*/); popup.show( {content: `$("[data-id='tmpEx']").single(".test").outerHtml.replace(/</g, "<")
${$("[data-id='tmpEx']").single(".test").outerHtml.replace(/</g, "<")}`, callback: () => $("[data-id='tmpEx']").remove()} ); indexOrSelector is empty: $(`
Hello world (1)
Hello world (2)
`, /*[root element]*/); popup.show( {content: `$("[data-id='tmpEx']").single().outerHtml.replace(/</g, "<")
${$("[data-id='tmpEx']").single().outerHtml.replace(/</g, "<")}`, callback: () => $("[data-id='tmpEx']").remove()} ); indexOrSelector is number: Note: retrieve a single element by number is zero based. $(`
Hello world (1)
Hello world (2)
Hello world (3)
`, /*[root element]*/); popup.show( {content: `$(".test_").single(1).outerHtml.replace(/</g, "<")
${$(".test").single(1).outerHtml.replace(/ $("[data-id='tmpEx']").remove()} );

params.indexOrSelector: string | number. An optional (valid) css selector.

instance_style.description:
Style each element of the of the JQL Instance element collection inline, so <div style="[the style from parameters]">. If keyOrKvPairs is a string and value is not empty, will set a single style value. Preferably use key-value pairs. Note: using !important will be honored, e.g. {color: `green !important`}. Equivalent to
[JQL instance].Style.inline

instance_trigger.description:
Trigger a handler for all elements of the the JQL Instance element collection. Note: bubbling is always true ({bubbles: true}), because event handling in this library uses event delegation. See the example @
the delegate documentation

params.SpecifiedEvent: Event. The event may be specified, e.g. MouseEvent. Defaults to generic Event

params.options: Object. Event options. Default {bubbles: true, cancelable: false, composed: false}

params.className: string. The class name to toggle (eg 'hidden')

static_text.description: Create a text or comment Node.

params.str: string. The text content of the node

static_popup.description:
Use the built in popup Factory. See
the documentation
.

popup_About.description: When initialized (e.g. const myPopup = [JQL].popup()), you can use the built in popup module. It contains 3 methods, documented in the following.

popup_create.description:
Create a popup. When isModalOrCallback is a boolean and true, the window can not be automatically closed, use removeModal for that. When isModalOrCallback is a function it will be called after the popup is closed. Other truthy values create a modal popup. Note: [popup].create is a legacy method. It is replaced with the more versatile (less convoluted)
show
method. When modalCallback is a function, it will be called after a modal popup is closed. The examples demonstrate both a modal popup and a regular one.

Hi. This box is really modal.
There is no close icon and clicking outside this box does nothing.
In other words: you can only close this using the button below.
Try clicking anywhere outside the box ...

Here's a popup message for you.

Close it by clicking the checkmark icon or anywhere outside the box

const { popup } = $; popup.create(`

Here's a popup message for you.

Close it by clicking the checkmark icon or anywhere outside the box

`); const $$ = $.virtual; const closeBttn = $$(``) .on(`click`, () => popup.removeModal()) const okMessage = () => popup.createTimed(`Modal closed, you're ok, bye.`, 2); const message = $$(`

Hi. This box is really modal.
There is no close icon and clicking outside this box does nothing.
In other words: you can only close this using the button below.
Try clicking anywhere outside the box ...

`).append($$(`

`).append(closeBttn)); popup.create(message, true, okMessage, "There's only one escape here!");

params.modalCallback: Function. Optional function to call after closing a modal popup.

params.modalWarning: Optional warning text when a user tries to close a modal popup without the preferred action.

popup_createTimed.description:
Create a (non modal) popup, that closes itself after closeAfter seconds.

Hi, this is a popup! I'll be active for 5 seconds (as long as you don't close me first).

const { popup } = $; popup.createTimed(`

Hi, this is a popup! I'll be active for 5 seconds (as long as you don't close me first).

`, 5);

params.message: string. A text or (valid) HTML string.

params.closeAfter: Number. The number of seconds after the popup closes itself. Default 2.

params.callback: Function. Optional function to call after closing the popup.

popup_removeModal.description:
Remove a modal popup. See the second example @
show
.

static_log.description:
Equivalent to
log
in
debugLog
, but for intermediate logging to console (so debugLog doesn't have to be set to 'on'). While loading this document this logging was called several times. See the console for that.

static_nodes.description: Retrieve or more DOM Nodes from [root]. The equivalent of Array.from([root].querySelectorAll([css selector])). Note: returns a real Array (not a NodeList), so all Array methods work on the result. For example: $.nodes(`.allGreen`).map(elem => elem.textContent += ` I'm green!`);.

static_node.description: Retrieve a DOM Node from [root]. The equivalent of [root].querySelector([css selector]). For example: const firstGreen = $.node(`.allGreen`);.

instance_prependTo.description:
Injects the current JQL Instance at the start of prependTo. If prependTo is a HTML string, it is converted to a JQL Instance and thus validated. The syntax equals
appendTo
.

debuglog_About.description:
To use extensive logging for debugging (or just follow the application flow) you can use a special object named debugLog. debugLog is a static property of the JQL module. Where a method returns debugLog (so itself) the result is chainable. Logging by default is to the browser console, but you can also log to a specially created element within your document. By default debug logging is not active. See it in action in the JQL demo. Note: errors when creating elements are always logged to the browser console. // JQL imported as $ const { debugLog } = $; if (!debugLog.isOn()) { debugLog .on() .toConsole // See the following .off() .log(`We started logging to div#logBox, enjoy ...`); } There are two extra properties in debugLog to note:
  • toConsole can be used to enable or disable logging to the browser console. Use toConsole.on() to enable, toConsole.off() to disable logging to the console.. By default logging to the console is enabled. If logging is not active, using toConsole.on/off will set the state for later usage.
  • reversed. By default logging (to screen) is from latest entry to the oldest. To log from first entry to the last you can use debugLog.reversed.on(), and vice versa use debugLog.reversed.off(). As with toConsole this is only useful if debug logging is active, and only if logging to console is off.

debuglog_isOn.description: Check if debug logging state is active.

debuglog_isVisible.description: When logging to screen is active, check if the special logging box is visible.

debuglog_on.description: Activate debug logging. By default logs all to the browser console. Use [JQL].debugLog.on().toConsole.off() to activate logging to screen.

debuglog_remove.description: Removes and deactivates all logging. If applicable removes the log box from the DOM. Note: reactivate debug logging with [JQL].debugLog.on().

debuglog_log.description:
Log one or more strings, either to the console or the DOM logging element. debugLog Must be on (so debugLog.isOn === true). Note For custom log messages to the console (independent of debugLog.isOn) you can use the
static [JQL].log method
.

debuglog_hide.description: Hide the DOM log box, if applicable (not logging to console).

debuglog_show.description: Show the DOM log box, if applicable (not logging to console).

debuglog_clear.description: Remove all strings logged until now from DOM log box or browser console.

static_setStyle.description:
Alias
editCssRule
. The method is kept for backward compatibility.

params....rules: string[]. One ore more css selectors

params.ruleOrSelector: string. A css selector (e.g. div[data-form]) or a css rule (e.g. .redBold {color: red; font-weight: bold;})

params.ruleObject: Object<string, string> pptional. When [ruleOrSelector] is a css selector, an object with rule properties.

static_allowTag.description: The creation of some html-tags are prohibited/not enabled by default (like <frameset>, or <script>). You can allow the creation of such tags using this static method.

params.tag2Allow: string. The html tag to allow (e.g. media)

static_prohibitTag.description: The creation of most html-tags is allowed by default. You can prohibit the creation of a tag using this the prohibitTag method, e.g. $.prohibitTag(`dialog`).

params.tag2Prohibit: string. The html tag to prohibit (e.g. details)

static_lenient.description:
You can call $.lenient().on() to allow creation of all html tags (even formally unknown tags), $.lenient().off() to undo that. By default lenient mode is off. Note: using lenient mode may get you into problems (element creation errors, security). It may be better to use
allowTag
for this.

instance_length.description:
The number of elements within the JQL instance element collection. $(`

There are ${$(`h3`).length} <h3>-elements within this document

`, /*[root element]*/);

popup_show.description:
Create and display a popup 'window'. There is one parameter, which is an Object with the following properties.
  • content: (JQL instance | HTML string | string) the message to show;
  • [modal]: (Boolean) true makes the popup modal;
  • [closeAfter]: (Number) the number of seconds after which the popup closes itself (ignored when modal);
  • [callback]: (Function) a function that will be executed after closing the popup;
  • [warnMessage]: (JQL instance | HTML string | string) a warning shown when the user clicks outside a modal popup (which normally closes a popup).
The only property that should have a value is content. The examples demonstrate a regular and modal popup.

Hi. This box is really modal.
There is no close icon and clicking outside this box does nothing.
In other words: you can only close this using the button below.
Try clicking anywhere outside the box ...

Here's a popup message for you.

Close it by clicking the checkmark icon or anywhere outside the box

const { popup } = $; popup.show({ content: `

Here's a popup message for you.

Close it by clicking the checkmark icon or anywhere outside the box

` } ); const $$ = $.virtual; const closeBttn = $$(``) .on(`click`, () => popup.removeModal()) const sayOK = () => popup.show( { content: `Modal closed, you're ok, bye.`, closeAfter: 2 } ); const message = $$(`

Hi. This box is really modal.
There is no close icon and clicking outside this box does nothing.
In other words: you can only close this using the button below.
Try clicking anywhere outside the box ...

`).append($$(`

`).append(closeBttn)); popup.show( { content: message, modal: true, callback: sayOK, warnMessage: `"In other words: <i>you can only close this using the <b>button</b> ...</i>"` } );

params....rules: string[]. One or more complete css rules
